intro: Elatostema rhombiforme, commonly known as the diamond leaf or small heartleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped or rhomboid leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Elatostema rhombiforme is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
